findings.title: Burn rights given to onlyOwner
findings.description: Only Owner can burn the tokens

findings.title: Setter for _rem_supply is missing
findings.description: If the owner wants to increase the _rem_supply in future then as per current implementation owner can’t do that. We recommend the user to make a setter for the _rem_supply with onlyOwner modifier.

findings.title: Variable visibility not defined
findings.description: On line 12 the visibility of _rem_supply has not been defined. We recommend using private visibility.

findings.title: Used locked pragma version
findings.description: The pragma versions used in the contract are not locked. Consider using the latest versions among 0.8.11 for deploying the contracts and libraries as it does not compile for any other version and can be confusing for a developer.

findings.title: Missing comments and description
findings.description: Comments and Description of the methods and the variables are missing, it's hard to read and understand the purpose of the variables and the methods in context of the whole picture

findings.title: Public methods only being used externally
findings.description: 'public' functions that are never used within the contract should be declared 'external' to save gas.
findings.function: **name, symbol, decimal, totalSupply, rem_supply, balanceOf, allowance, approve, transferFrom, increaseAllowance, decreaseAllowance, _mint, transferOwnership, renounceOwnership**

findings.title: _mint name should changed to mint
findings.description: Mostly _mint is used for internal methods, not for external/public. We recommend using mint instead of _mint.

findings.title: Unchecked external call
findings.description: The audit report highlights an unchecked external call vulnerability.

findings.title: Unchecked maths
findings.description: No description provided

findings.title: Re-entrancy
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Timestamp Dependence
findings.description: The smart contract codebase was checked for Timestamp Dependence vulnerability.

findings.title: Gas Limit and Loops
findings.description: Potential issue with gas limit and loops in smart contract code

findings.title: DoS with Block Gas Limit
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Transaction-Ordering Dependence
findings.description: Vulnerability related to transaction ordering dependence.

findings.title: Use of tx.origin
findings.description: The contract uses tx.origin which can make it vulnerable to phishing attacks.

findings.title: Exception disorder
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Gasless send
findings.description: Public methods only being used externally should be declared ‘external’ to save gas.
findings.function: Multiple functions (name, symbol, decimal, totalSupply, rem_supply, balanceOf, allowance, approve, transferFrom, increaseAllowance, decreaseAllowance, _mint, transferOwnership, renounceOwnership)

findings.title: Balance equality
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Byte array
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Transfer forwards all gas
findings.description: The transfer function forwards all gas to the recipient, which can lead to unintended behavior and potential reentrancy attacks.

findings.title: ERC20 API violation
findings.description: Violation of ERC-20 token standards implementation.

findings.title: Malicious libraries
findings.description: The smart contract uses malicious libraries which can cause potential security risks.

findings.title: Compiler version not fixed
findings.description: The pragma versions used in the contract are not locked, which can cause confusion for developers and lead to compilation issues.

findings.title: Redundant fallback function
findings.description: The contract contains a redundant fallback function which can lead to unnecessary gas consumption and potential security risks.

findings.title: Send instead of transfer
findings.description: Using 'send' instead of 'transfer' can lead to unintended behavior and potential security risks.

findings.title: Style guide violation
findings.description: N/A
